item.title: Shaking Off the Rust 1: Ray Tracing in One Weekend
item.description: Two classes stand out as my favorites from computer science at NCSU: x86 assembly, taught by Dana Lasher, and computer graphics, taught by Stuart Heinrich. In the graphics course, we wrote a rasterizer and a ray tracer (which I never finished ðŸ˜…). In the 16 years since, I’ve been working happily in web development, but I’ve started to lament losing touch with lower-level, near-metal (ðŸ¤˜) programming which captured my interest so much in college.
